submission.title: Family-Centered Introduction of the Meta-Layer for Safer, Co-Creative Internet Engagement
submission.overview: This submission proposes a public introduction strategy for the Meta-Layer and the Overweb that centers on families—parents, children, and teenagers—by addressing their everyday digital challenges and aspirations. It emphasizes trust-based engagement over restriction, promoting an environment where youth can safely explore, learn, and contribute meaningfully to the co-creation of digital culture. Rather than pursuing institutional entry points (e.g., via schools or governments), this strategy focuses on engaging family media—parenting magazines, youth outlets, school take-home materials—with an invitation to participate. The initiative envisions the Meta-Layer as a viable alternative to the corporate internet, providing young people with a healthier, more creative, and civically empowered online life. This submission was generated with protocol META-DP-EVAL-v1.3.

directly_addressed_dps.summary: Empowers youth and parents alike to shape online experiences collaboratively rather than being passive consumers.
Highlights the Meta-Layer as a safer space with reduced surveillance and predatory behavior, appealing to family concerns.
Uses existing family-facing channels for scalable, low-friction adoption and introduces the Meta-Layer in everyday contexts.
Encourages intergenerational co-creation and cross-contextual participation in a shared digital commons.
Positions the Meta-Layer as an informal learning platform that bridges home, school, and community experiences.
Promotes a digital space where families can trust the presence of ethical moderation and containment of harmful bots.

directly_addressed_dps.dp: DP19 – Amplifying Presence and Community Engagement
directly_addressed_dps.summary: Strategically engages parents and youth to organically expand the Meta-Layer's visibility and use within communities.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Intergenerational and School-Linked Learning Pathways
clarifications_and_extensions.clarification: This proposal expands 'education' beyond institutional curricula to include home-based, peer-led, and informal learning. Parents become curators and facilitators, offering their children a civic internet alternative through simple actions like sharing flyers or recommending the Meta-Layer to educators.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: This distributed model builds long-term familiarity and normalization of the Meta-Layer, empowering youth to integrate it across different areas of life—school, home, and community—without waiting for top-down institutional reform.

clarifications_and_extensions.dp: DP19 – Amplifying Presence and Community Engagement
clarifications_and_extensions.title: Press-Driven Family Campaigns
clarifications_and_extensions.extension: Rather than relying on tech-centric or policy-focused channels, this submission advocates using widely read family media outlets as primary vectors of adoption. Press kits, parenting articles, and youth-oriented features can provide narrative bridges into the Meta-Layer.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: These channels are low-cost, high-reach, and trusted by parents. They offer a fast route to community-scale adoption while reinforcing the Meta-Layer's values of care, creativity, and shared stewardship.
